definitions.definition: : To yield to a temptation or desire .
examples: He looked at the chocolate but didn't indulge .
I indulged in drinking on the weekend.

definitions.definition: To satisfy the wishes or whims of.
examples: Grandma indulges the kids with sweets.
I love to indulge myself with beautiful clothes.

definitions.definition: To give way to (a habit or temptation ); to not oppose or restrain .
examples: to indulge sloth, pride, selfishness, or inclinations

definitions.definition: To grant an extension to the deadline of a payment .
To grant as by favour ; to bestow in concession , or in compliance with a wish or request .

main_definition: ( intransitive , often followed by "in" ) : To yield to a temptation or desire .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To satisfy the wishes or whims of.
To give way to (a habit or temptation ); to not oppose or restrain .
To grant an extension to the deadline of a payment .
To grant as by favour ; to bestow in concession , or in compliance with a wish or request .
